Parameter.Help: Flush 1 relay module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system.

Parameter.Label: Automatic turning off output Q1 after set time
Parameter.Help:
When relay Q1 is ON it goes automatically OFF after time defined by this parameter. Timer is reset to zero each time the module receive ON command regardless from where it comes (push button, associated module, controller,..).
  • 0 - Auto OFF disabled
  • 1 – 32535 = 1second (0,01s) – 32535 seconds (325,35s) Auto OFF enabled with define time, step is 1s or 10ms according to parameter nr.15

Parameter.Label: Automatic turning on output Q1 after set time
Parameter.Help:
When relay Q1 is OFF it goes automatically ON after time defined by this parameter. Timer is reset to zero each time the module receive OFF command regardless from where it comes (push button, associated module, controller,..).
  • 0 - Auto ON disabled
  • 1 – 32535 = 1second (0,01s) – 32535 seconds (325,35s) Auto ON enabled with define time, step is 1s or 10ms according to parameter nr.15

Parameter.Label: Automatic turning off relay Q2 after set time
Parameter.Help:
When relay Q2 is ON it goes automatically OFF after time defined by this parameter. Timer is reset to zero each time the module receive ON command regardless from where it comes (push button, associated module, controller,..).
  • 0 - Auto OFF disabled
  • 1 – 32535 = 1second (0,01s) – 32535 seconds (325,35s) Auto OFF enabled with define time, step is 1s or 10ms according to parameter nr.15

Parameter.Label: Automatic turning on output Q2 after set time
Parameter.Help:
When relay Q2 is OFF it goes automatically ON after time defined by this parameter. Timer is reset to zero each time the module receive OFF command regardless from where it comes (push button, associated module, controller,..).
  • 0 - Auto ON disabled
  • 1 – 32535 = 1second (0,01s) – 32535 seconds (325,35s) Auto ON enabled with define time, step is 1s or 10ms according to parameter nr.15

Parameter.Label: Automatic turning off / on seconds or milliseconds selection
Parameter.Help:
Available configuration parameters:
  • 0 – seconds selected
  • 1 – milliseconds selected

NOTE: Parameter is valid for both outputs Q1, Q2 and is the same for turning off or on.

Flush 2 relays module does not save the state after a power failure, it returns to "off" position.

Parameter.Help: Saving the state of the relays Q1 and Q2 after a power failure

Parameter.Label: Power reporting in Watts on power change for Q1
Parameter.Help:
Power report is sent (pushed) only when actual power in Watts in real time changed for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%.
  • 0 = Reporting Disabled
  • 1–100 = 1% - 100% Reporting enabled
NOTE: if power changed is less than 1W, the report is not sent (pushed), regardless of percentage set.

Parameter.Label: Power reporting in Watts on power change for Q2
Parameter.Help:
Power report is sent (pushed) only when actual power in Watts in real time changed for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%.
  • 0 = Reporting Disabled
  • 1–100 = 1% - 100% Reporting enabled
NOTE: if power changed is less than 1W, the report is not sent (pushed), regardless of percentage set.

Parameter.Label: Power reporting in Watts by time interval for Q1
Parameter.Help:
default value is 300 (power report in Watts is sent each 300s)
  • 0 = Reporting Disabled
  • 1–32535 = 1 second – 32535 seconds. Reporting enabled. Power report is sent with time interval set by entered value.

Parameter.Label: Power reporting in Watts by time interval for Q2
Parameter.Help:
default value is 300 (power report in Watts is sent each 300s)
  • 0 = Reporting Disabled
  • 1–32535 = 1 second – 32535 seconds. Reporting enabled. Power report is sent with time interval set by entered value.

Parameter.Label: Temperature sensor offset settings
Parameter.Help:
Set value result in adding or subtracting that value to actual measured value by sensor
  • 32536 – offset is 0.0 °C
  • From 1 to 1000 – value from 0.1 °C to 10.0 °C is added to actual measured temperature.

Parameter.Label: Digital temperature sensor reporting
Parameter.Help:
If digital temperature sensor is connected, module reports measured temperature on temperature change defined by this parameter.
  • 0 – Reporting disabled
  • 1-127 = 0,1°C – 12,7°C, step is 0,1°C
